content.description: Climb gets progressively harder and very sustained with plenty of crimps. Definite crux right before the anchors.
content.location:
Just right of

Metro

and just left of the right arete, with Flesh and Blood to the right.

content.description:
Scramble up to the 1st bolt, mantle onto a debris covered ledge to reach the 2nd bolt (hard to clip) and then up some big holds (5.10) to another debris covered ledge. Clip another bolt, mantle onto yet another debris covered ledge and then finish up a short face with two bolts. The crux is after the 5th bolt and involves small edges and some marginal smears.

Decent climbing on this but a

whisk broom

might be useful as part of your rack due to all of the debris - fortunately most of it's small.

Also the placement of the last two bolts is unfortunate as the hardest moves on the route are getting to the last bolt and a fall right before might have serious consequences as you swing down and left onto the (debris covered) ledge.
content.location:
Located on the right side of the huge perched block that houses the

Pioneer Route

(5.10d).

content.description:
This climb shares it's start with

Indecision

.

Start up the large flake / block to gain the sandy ledge.  From the sandy ledge head directly up the steep wall with a fingery sequence to gain better holds above.

Continue up the faint arete, until holds run out, and a short traverse left is required.  After the move left make a powerful sequence of moves up and right.

Finish easily up the flaked crack.

This pitch climbs harder than it looks with a series of boulder problems mostly separated by decent rests. Long reaches and/or dynos through a series of bulges make it feel much steeper than it looks from the ground. There are a few cruxes, and which is the redpoint crux for you will likely depend on height. A big huck to a drilled pocket at 1/3 height, a crimpy high-step sequence at 2/3, and a very reachy and/or technical sequence to gain some sloping arete pinching past the last bolt will keep you entertained.
content.location: This route is on the left side of the Metro Sector, located just to the right of Burly Boogie and takes a line a few feet right of the right end of the low roof. Starts at the faded, but legible "Punk's Not Dead" graffiti.

content.description: This is a fun route, the moves to the 2nd horizontal crack/ledge are fairly easy, the meat of the route is the last 15-20 feet. Look out for the last hand hold; it is slick and has spit many a climber off.
content.location: It is far left of the roof area, a short hike up a scree slope is necessary to reach the bottom the climb, look for a precariously balanced block, the route is just to the right

content.description:
Start climbing up a wide crack and some large blocks to gain a good ledge.   From the right end of the ledge head straight up the shallow corner with staightforward climbing until a couple of bolts below the top.

The climbing becomes more powerful as you pass the crux and head up to the anchors.

Climb large, positive holds through bulging terrain to a distinct crux just past the 5th bolt as you traverse left above the lip of a small roof. Once past the crux the angle subsides for a bit and a combination of stemming and liebacking past blocky corners and flakes through progressively steeper terrain leads to another crux between the last bolt and the anchors.

Great climbing on this route which feels a lot like climbing at Owens River Gorge in the lower portion and a little like

Tangerine Dream

up high. Originally done with 8 bolts, which made it a bit more "heady" to lead, but now with the addition of two more bolts it's very well protected and a must do route for the grade.
content.location:
Located on the right side of the Metro Sector with

Voyeurism

(5.12a) to the right and

Peepshow

(5.10c) to the left.

content.description:
Located on the right side of the Metro Sector at the left end of the patio where

Metro

is located.

Start up

Rendezvous

for two bolts and then head left into the leaning corner system and stem and lieback up to a cruxy move just before joining Rendezvous for it's last two bolts and shared anchors.

Although scrappy looking the moves on this are actually quite good, making it a worthwhile route if in the vicinity.

Climb up to a low roof which starts the cruxy section.  The 12b/c crux is moving past the 4th bolt and clipping the 5th.  The climbing eases until 2 bolts below the anchors where a last push of power and sequence is required.
content.location: Route is right of Tagger and left of Burly Boogie

content.description: 7 Bolts on a somewhat slabby face. Various sections of slab mixed with ledges for the non needed rests.
content.protection: 7 bolts, to 2 ring anchors.  Handy dandy belay chain link for the ledge style belay.
content.location: 20 feet below the climbs Peepshow and Metro

content.description: Start under a small bulge and continue up the right-facing dihedral finishing on the arete. The climbing starts to get interesting as you establish yourself on the arete, a few technical moves and a couple tricky clips get you through the crux section.
content.location: Six feet right of Graffiti Wisdom
